title-group.article-title: Crash-Resistant Fuel Tanks for Helicopters and General Aviation Aircraft

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc. 1975

abstract.p: Crashworthy fuel tanks have been developed for U.S. Army helicopters which have demonstrated excellent performance in over three years of service. Although design guidelines evolving from this work have a direct bearing on the application of crashworthy fuel cells for general aviation aircraft, additional development work is required to provide tanks with minimum cost and weight penalties.

ref.mixed-citation: J. Sommers, Jr. and J. H. Clark, "The Development of Aircraft Crash-Resistant Fuel Cells, Safety Valves, and Break- away Accessories." SAE Paper 5 17D presented at SAE Na- tional Aeronautic Meeting, New York, April 1962.

R. L. Field, M. F. Miller, and G. L. Pigman, "An Inves- tigation of the Crash-Fire Problems in Transport Aircraft Fuel Tanks." Technical Development Report No. 134, CAA Tech- nical Development and Evaluation Center, Indianapolis, Janu- ary 1951.

R. N. Motsinger, M. F. Miller, and R. J. Schroers, "Some Physical Properties of Proposed Constructions of Materials for Nonmetallic Crash-Resistant Aircraft Fuel Tanks." Technical Development Report No. 220, CAA Technical Development and Evaluation Center, Indianapolis, December 1953.

C. V. Bennett and R. J. Schroers, "Impact Tests of Flex- ible Nonmetallic Aircraft Fuel Tanks Installed in Two Cate- gories of Simulated Wing Structures." Technical Development Report No. 29 1, CAA Technical Development Center. Indiana- polis, January 1957.

D. A. Hillman and R. J. Schroers, "Calculation of the Strength of Crash-Resistant Fuel Cells for the Wings of a Twin- Engine and a Four-Engine Transport Airplane." FAA Final Report Task No. 59-203.4, Systems Research and Develop- ment Service, Experimentation Division, Atlantic City, April 1961.
Military Specification, MIL-T-27422A, "Tank, Fuel, Crash Resistant, Aircraft." Issued July 1960 as MIL-T-27422 (USAF) and revised March 1964.
"Crash-Resistant Fuel Tanks for Fuselages of Aircraft." Paper presented at the Crash-Resistant Fuel Tank Conference, Technical Development Center, Indianapolis, June 1956.
Military Specification, MIL-V-27393 (USAF), "General Specification for Valve, Safety, Crash-Resistant, Aircraft." July 1960.
Military Specification, MIL-T-6396B (ASG), "Tanks, Fuel, Oil, Water-Alcohol, Coolant Fluid, Aircraft, Non-Self- Sealing, Removable, Internal." November 1958.

F. P. McCourt and W. J. Nolan, "Aviation Crash Injury Research." TREC Report 61-78, U. S. Army Transportation Research Command, Fort Eustis, Va. Presented at the Bureau of Naval Weapons and Air Crew Equipment Symposium on the Biomechanics of Body Restraint and Head Protection, Phila- delphia, June 1961.

S. H. Robertson and J. W. Turnbow, "Aircraft Fuel Tank Design Criteria." USAAVLABS Technical Report 66-24 prepared by AvSER Division of Flight Safety Foundation, Phoenix under contract DA 44-177-AMC-254(T) for U. S. Army Aviation Material Laboratories, Fort Eustis, Va., March 1966.

R. L. Cook, R. A. Huyett, and R. E. Baker, "Improved Crash-Resistant Fuel Cell Material." USAAVLABS Report 67-6 prepared by Goodyear Aerospace Corp., Litchfield Park, Arizona for U. S. Army Aviation Material Laboratories, Fort Eustis, Va., April 1967.
W. C. McDonald, "New Energy -Absorbing Materials for Crash-Resistant Fuel Tanks." Paper 680210 presented at SAE Business Aircraft Meeting, Wichita, Kansas, April 1968.
Military Specification, MIL-T-27422B, "Tank, Fuel, Crash-Resistant, Aircraft." Revision of February 1970.

J. W. Turnbow et al., "Crash Survival Design Guide." USAAVLABS Report 67-22 prepared by AvSER Division of Flight Safety Foundation, Inc., Phoenix, for U. S. Army Avia- tion Material Laboratories, Fort Eustis, Va., December 1967 revision.

W. F. Gabella and W. L. Young, "Summary of U. S. Army Crashworthy Fuel Systems Accident Experience, 1970- 1973." Prepared by The U. S. Army Agency for Aviation Safety, Fort Rucker, Ala., Vol. 2, No. 3 (1973). An article ap- pearing in System Safety News Letter.

"Crash Survival Design Guide." USAAMRDL Technical Report 71-22 prepared by Dynamic Science (The AvSER Fa- cility) a Division of Marshal Ind., Phoenix for U. S. Army Air Mobility Research and Development Laboratory, Eustis Direc- torate, Fort Eustis, Va., October 1971.
H. D. Hoekstra and S. C. Huang, "Safety in General Aviation." Report by Flight Safety Foundation, Inc., Arling- ton, Va., December 1971.
Major E. R. Widmer, "UH-1 Crashworthy Fuel System." Article appearing in U. S. Army Aviation Digest, March 1971.
